name: Fried Shrimp to Die For
author: Tina Elliott
summary: If you're a fan of fried shrimp, I've got your family covered! Light, crispy, and ... I just can't brag anymore. It's my Nan's recipe and I've never shared it. Please try it, I promise you won't be disappointed. I'd love to hear some comments. Please be easy on me, this is my first post, but I'm sure you'll be happy making these babies! They rock!
ingredients: 1 pound raw shrimp, peeled and deveined
¼ cup all-purpose flour, or as needed
½ cup vegetable oil for frying
directions: Insert a knife 3/4 of the way below the head of 1 shrimp and cut down the center of the shrimp's back to the tail
Open shrimp with your fingers so it lies flat
Pour flour onto a shallow plate
Whisk eggs and water together in a small bowl to make egg wash
Place saltine crackers in a large resealable bag
Crush into fine crumbs using a rolling pin
Dip in egg wash; roll in cracker crumbs on both sides
Heat 1 inch vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat
Cook shrimp until golden brown, 1 1/2 to 2 minutes per side
Drain on a paper-towel lined plate
